item.description:
Myles Standish State Forest may be naturally pretty but the park needs some TLC from time to time. This is our day to help out on some projects that are important to all of us.  Last year, 85 people joined us and almost 5000 people helped out in parks all over the state. (You can see more info at the state's Park Serve web page.)

Please arrive around 9:00 AM to sign in and enjoy coffee and donuts with the park staff and other Friends.  Myles Standish State Forest Supervisor John Roberts will welcome us and explain the projects we will be doing.

Last year, we split into two groups--One group led by Thom Gifford worked sprucing up the Charge Pond equestrian camping area and trails. (note to equestrians-- take some pictures this year!)

The other painted trail blazes and put up new signs along the Bentley Loop hiking trail off Upper College Pond Road.



 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We don't have the details on exactly where we'll be working yet but after this tough winter, there is certainly a lot to be done to help make the park more enjoyable for everybody.

Volunteers are encouraged to bring their own hand tools as the state has a limited supply to lend out. Power tools are not allowed.  Please mark all tools for easy identification. All ages are welcome.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Friends of Myles Standish SF will supply water and snacks and will also host a BBQ lunch for all volunteers and staff at the Headquarters Amphitheater around 1:15 PM.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Last year, Peter's beans were a hit.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Please also sign up at the DCR Park Serve Day web page ( link goes to http://parkserv.env.state.ma.us/ ) in addition to signing up here so that you can be counted in the official tally.

We look forward to seeing you out there!

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Park Serve Day
